title: DOJ Settles Ashli Babbitt Lawsuit for $5 Million, Sparking Law Enforcement Controversy
summary: The Trump administration's Department of Justice agreed to pay $5 million to settle a wrongful death lawsuit brought by the family of Ashli Babbitt, the January 6 rioter fatally shot while attempting to breach the Capitol. The settlement, which resolves a $30 million suit, drew criticism from Capitol Police leadership who argued it sends a 'chilling message' to law enforcement.
description: The DOJ agreed to pay January 6 insurrectionist Ashli Babbitt's family $5 million to settle their lawsuit, signaling potential systemic legal manipulation and political influence in law enforcement accountability.

sources.title: US to Settle With Family of Woman Killed During 2021 Capitol Riot
Ashli Babbitt's family to receive $5 million in settlement with Trump administration: Sources
Ashli Babbitt wrongful-death suit to be settled for nearly $5 million

notes: Event highlights complex legal and political dynamics surrounding the January 6 Capitol riot.
